comments.body: Shouldn't these both just return false instead of asserting?  If their colors are null or not the same length, then they're just not equal.

I'm doing that here to stay consistent with the LinearGradient and RadialGradient implementations, I'm not sure why they assert on color and stops differences though. That was introduced in [this commit](https://github.com/Hixie/flutter/commit/552f26d71324e559e69a38e5ecc16c3110c580ab#diff-1756a3cb685f68e4d8f389736fda0df2R379) if it helps make sense of it?.

My best guess is it was added so that attempting to animate between gradients with different colors/stops would assert (although  `lerp` would assert in that case, so it seems redundant?)
For consistency, I guess just leave them there, then, and I'll put together another PR that will remove them all after talking it over with @Hixie as to why they're in there.
same here for the stops asserts: shouldn't they just return false?
